result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Friend was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft-Intent. Take >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Michigan

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Not ot use or possess any weapons.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with co-actors or with any businesses or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions, commencing forthwith. Transfer allowed to the State of Michigan where defendant resides.  Sentence credit of 190 days was granted.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit sheet
Qualifications summary regarding Barry D. Hargan, MS, MHA, LPC, CADC III filed by Attorney Redetzke

Defendant Anthony D Friend in court, in custody, with Attorney Kirk A. Redetzke.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Attorney Redetzke states/recites corrections to the PSI report. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements regarding sentencing.  Pastor H. makes statements.  Defendant's mother, Nina W. makes statements.   Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS    **Transfer allowed to State of Michigan** 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actors or with businesses/witnesses listed in criminal complaint 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Not to use or possess any weapons

CONDITION TIME:  12 MONTHS (credit for 190 days), Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith. Defendant already in custody. Transfer allowed to State of Michigan (where Defendant resides)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
6 separate character letters filed today.
Alternative presentence investigation report. Filed by Dr. Hargan.
Sentencing hearing on December 10, 2014 at 10:15 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony D Friend in court, in custody, with Attorney Kirk A. Redetzke.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation and sets sentencing date. Court addresses bail motion filed by Attorney Redetzke.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements/arguments regarding request for modification of bail.  State objects to any bail modification.  Attorney Redetzke makes additional statements.  Court denies request for bail modification and revokes bail, ordering Defendant held in custody until sentencing.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Anthony D Friend in court, in custody, with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Sam Wegleitner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario brings motion to modify bail.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding his request for bail modification.   State objects to any bail modification. Defendant Anthony D Friend in court, in custody, with attorney J A Rosario.   Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Todd Higgins from the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Rosario. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over. Atty. Rosario moves to dismiss.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Atty. Rosario makes a Motion to Modify Bail. State objects to any modification of bail. Court denies any modification of bail.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
